definition: to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth
zookeeper/stockman/breeder (of livestock, dogs or poultry etc)

sentences.english: Under the condition of artificial feeding, effect of using cement quadrel to collect eggs was good.
sentences.chinese: 在人工饲养条件下，利用水泥方砖采卵效果良好。

sentences.english: Breeding and management programs for beef cattle fell apart.
sentences.chinese: 肉牛的饲养和管理计划也崩溃了。

sentences.english: Our Stone Age ancestors certainly did not live in a feedlot.
sentences.chinese: 我们石器时代的祖先当然没有生活在饲养场。

sentences.english: I am a F. 5 student who is so fond of keeping pets.
sentences.chinese: 本人是一名中五学生，从小对饲养宠物有浓厚兴趣。

sentences.english: In the United States, there are breeders who raise and sell burros .
sentences.chinese: 在美国，有饲养并贩卖驴子的饲养员。

sentences.english: In the United States, there are breeders who raise and sell burros .
sentences.chinese: 在美国，有饲养并贩卖驴子的饲养员。

sentences.english: These goats are specially bred for their wool.
sentences.chinese: 这些山羊是专为剪取羊毛而饲养的。

sentences.english: We also raise fish in those ponds over there.
sentences.chinese: 我们同样在那里的池塘里饲养鱼。

sentences.english: Rearing by imprinted birds with a certain amount of human contact.
sentences.chinese: 通过保持一定量的人为接触去饲养带铭印的鸟。

sentences.english: One of Tai Shan's caretakers and a veterinarian from the Washington National Zoo are expected to accompany them on the journey.
sentences.chinese: 泰山的一个饲养员和一名兽医希望在旅途中陪伴泰山。

sentences.english: They increased their income by raising silkworms and so on.
sentences.chinese: 他们靠饲养蚕等增加了收入。

sentences.english: The first, this coming Jan. 1, is a ban on caging egg-laying hens.
sentences.chinese: 明年1月1号首先被禁止的是笼子饲养的产蛋鸡。

sentences.english: Today there are more than eight hundred breeds of cattle raised for different reasons.
sentences.chinese: 现在因各种原因饲养的牛有八百多种。

sentences.english: Mr. Reese's Bronze turkeys have a family tree.
sentences.chinese: 里斯饲养的青铜色火鸡是有家谱的。

sentences.english: Rearing tank is the Ranchu unique living environment.
sentences.chinese: 饲养水槽是兰寿唯一的生存环境。

definition: to rear (an animal) in an enclosure
to feed (a child, domestic animal etc)/to keep/to raise (an animal)
to breed (livestock, fish, crops etc)/to grow/to raise
to keep (an animal)/to look after the needs of (a person or an animal)/(fig.) to keep (a spy, lackey etc) in one's pay
to give birth (animals)/to bear a litter
